questions.title: Prefix vs Postfix Increment
questions.explanation: i++ returns 5 then increments to 6. ++i increments to 7 then returns 7. Final value of i is 7. Output: 5 7 7
hints: i++ uses the value then increments
After i++, i becomes 6. After ++i, i becomes 7

questions.title: Short-Circuit Safety
questions.explanation: The left side of && is false (x != 0), so the right side is never evaluated. That prevents division by zero, and the else branch prints B.
hints: && short-circuits when the left side is false

questions.title: Switch Fallthrough
questions.explanation: Execution jumps to case 2 and prints B, then breaks. Case 1 is not executed because the switch matches case 2 directly.
hints: The switch jumps directly to case 2

questions.title: Dangling Else
questions.explanation: The else binds to the nearest if (the inner one). Since b is 0, it prints Y.
hints: Else pairs with the closest unmatched if

questions.title: For Loop Sum
questions.explanation: The loop adds 0 + 1 + 2, which is 3.

questions.title: Continue Skips
questions.explanation: The odd numbers between 0 and 4 are 1 and 3, so count increments twice.

questions.title: Switch Fallthrough to Default
questions.explanation: Case 3 prints C, then falls through to default and prints D.

questions.title: Ternary Operator
questions.explanation: Since x > 3 is true, y becomes x - 1, which is 4.

questions.title: Do-While Runs Once
questions.explanation: The do-while loop executes once before checking the condition, so x becomes 1.

questions.title: Empty Loop Body
questions.explanation: The semicolon makes the loop body empty. The loop runs until i == 5, then prints 5.
hints: The semicolon ends the loop body

questions.title: Short-Circuit OR
questions.explanation: The left side of || is true, so the right side is not evaluated. It prints A.

questions.title: Nested Loop Count
questions.explanation: The inner loop runs 1 + 2 + 3 times, so count becomes 6.

questions.title: Switch with char
questions.explanation: The switch matches case 'b' and prints B.

questions.title: Assignment in Condition
questions.explanation: x = 5 assigns 5 to x, and the expression is nonzero, so the if condition is true.

questions.title: Post-Decrement in While
questions.explanation: i-- returns 3, 2, 1, then 0. The loop runs three times, so count is 3.
hints: The condition uses the old value of i
Loop runs while the value is nonzero

questions.title: Switch Statement
questions.explanation: No break statements, so execution falls through from case 2 to case 3 to default. Prints BCD.
hints: Prints B, then C, then D

questions.title: Nested Loops
questions.description: How many times does this print 'X'?
questions.explanation: Outer loop runs 3 times, inner loop runs 2 times each. 3 * 2 = 6.

questions.title: Break Statement
questions.explanation: Loop breaks when i == 3, so only prints 0, 1, 2.

questions.title: Continue Statement
questions.explanation: continue skips the rest of iteration when i == 2, so doesn't print 2.

questions.title: Do-While Loop
questions.explanation: do-while executes body once before checking condition. Prints 5, then condition fails.

questions.title: Variable Scope
questions.explanation: Local variable x in func() shadows global x. func() prints 20, main() prints global x = 10.
hints: Each x is in different scope

questions.title: Block Scope
questions.explanation: Block inside if creates new scope. Inner x=10 shadows outer x=5 within block. Outside block, outer x=5 is used.

questions.title: Enum Basic Usage
questions.explanation: Enum values start at 0 by default. RED=0, GREEN=1, BLUE=2.

questions.title: Enum Custom Values
questions.explanation: Enum values can be explicitly assigned. NOT_FOUND is 404.

questions.title: Typedef for Struct
options: Creates a new type incompatible with struct
questions.explanation: typedef creates an alias. You can use 'Point' instead of 'struct Point'.

questions.title: Type Cast
questions.explanation: Casting double to int truncates (doesn't round). 9.7 becomes 9.

questions.title: Ternary Operator
questions.explanation: Ternary operator: condition ? true_value : false_value. x > 5 is true, so y = 100.

questions.title: Logical AND Short-circuit
questions.explanation: Short-circuit: x is 0 (false), so (y = 10) is never evaluated. y remains 5.

questions.title: Assert Statement
questions.description: What happens when this runs with an assertion?
questions.explanation: assert checks condition. If false, program aborts with error message. b=0 fails assertion.

questions.title: NDEBUG Macro
questions.description: What does #define NDEBUG do to assertions?
questions.explanation: NDEBUG disables all assertions. assert(0) is removed, program continues normally.

questions.title: While vs Do-While
options: Loop A may not execute, Loop B executes at least once
questions.explanation: do-while checks condition after body, so executes at least once. while checks before.

questions.title: Comma Operator in For
questions.explanation: Comma operator allows multiple expressions. j starts at 10 and decrements. Prints: 10 9 8.

questions.title: Break on Condition
questions.explanation: The loop breaks when i reaches 2, so it prints 2.

questions.title: Skip Evens
questions.explanation: Odd values are 1, 3, 5, so count is 3.

questions.title: For Loop Step
questions.explanation: The loop adds 1 + 3 + 5 = 9.

questions.title: Logical Precedence
questions.explanation: && has higher precedence than ||. y && z is 0, then x || 0 is 0.

questions.title: Nested Loops Count
questions.explanation: 2 outer iterations * 3 inner iterations = 6.

questions.title: Else Binding
questions.explanation: The outer if is false, so the inner if/else is skipped and nothing prints.

questions.title: Switch Default
questions.explanation: x is 4, so default executes and prints D.

questions.title: Do-While Decrement
questions.explanation: x goes 2 -> 1 -> 0, then stops. Prints 0.

questions.title: Switch Fallthrough Chain
questions.explanation: Switch jumps to case 1, prints 'A', then falls through to case 2 (prints 'B'), then falls through to case 3 (prints 'C'), then hits break. Output: ABC
hints: No break statements in case 1 and 2

questions.title: Nested Loop with Break
questions.explanation: Break only exits the inner loop when i=1 and j=1. Iteration i=0: prints 00 01 02. i=1: prints 10, then breaks at j=1. i=2: prints 20 21 22.
hints: Break only affects the innermost loop

questions.title: Goto Statement Jump
questions.explanation: Prints 'A', then goto jumps to label 'skip', skipping 'B', then prints 'C'. Output: AC
hints: Code between goto and label is skipped

questions.title: Short-Circuit Side Effects
questions.explanation: The assignment a = 1 evaluates to 1 (true), so the OR short-circuits and b = 1 is never executed. Output: 1 0
hints: || short-circuits when left side is true

questions.title: Comma Operator in Expression
questions.explanation: Comma operator evaluates left to right and returns the rightmost value. y = 3 sets y to 3, then y + 2 evaluates to 5, which is assigned to x. Output: 5 3
hints: Returns the value of the right expression

questions.title: Nested Ternary Operator
questions.explanation: x > 10 is false, so evaluates the second ternary. x > 3 is true, so y = 2. Output: 2

questions.title: Duff's Device Concept
questions.description: What is the primary purpose of Duff's device?
questions.explanation: Duff's device is an advanced loop unrolling technique that combines a switch statement with a loop to optimize memory copy operations by reducing loop overhead.

questions.title: Continue in Nested Loop
questions.explanation: Continue skips j=1 in the inner loop. For i=0: prints 0, 2. For i=1: prints 0, 2. Output: 0202

questions.title: While vs Do-While Difference
questions.explanation: While loop condition is false initially, so it doesn't run. Do-while executes once before checking condition. Output: B

questions.title: Complex Boolean Expression
questions.explanation: Expression: (a && b) || (c && !b). First part: 1 && 0 = 0. Second part: 1 && 1 = 1. Result: 0 || 1 = 1 (True). Output: True
hints: Evaluate left to right with precedence

questions.title: Goto with Loop
questions.explanation: Goto creates a loop-like structure. Prints 0, 1, 2, then exits when i reaches 3. Output: 0 1 2

questions.title: Switch with Default First
questions.explanation: Default position doesn't matter. Switch jumps to case 2, prints 'B'. No break, so execution ends. Output: B
hints: Switch jumps directly to matching case

questions.title: For Loop Initialization
questions.explanation: For loop reinitializes i to 0, prints 0 1 2, then i becomes 3 when loop exits. Output: 0 1 2 3

questions.title: Ternary with Side Effects
questions.explanation: Condition x > 3 is true, so y = 10 is executed and its value (10) is assigned to result. Output: 10 10

questions.title: Comma Operator in Loop Update
questions.explanation: First iteration: x=0, y=5, prints 5. Second iteration: x=1, y=4, prints 4. Output: 5 4
hints: Both x and y change each iteration

questions.title: Short-Circuit AND Evaluation
questions.explanation: x is 0 (false), so && short-circuits and y = 10 is never executed. y remains 5. Output: 5

questions.title: Infinite For Loop
questions.description: Which of these creates an infinite loop?
questions.explanation: A: for(;;) is infinite (no condition means always true). B: Missing condition means always true. C: i never increments but will eventually be optimized or timeout, but technically finite if broken. A and B are infinite.
hints: C doesn't increment but has a condition

questions.title: Nested Ternary Precedence
questions.explanation: Ternary is right-associative but the first one evaluates first. x is 1 (true), so result = y = 2. The second ternary is never evaluated. Output: 2

questions.title: Break from Switch in Loop
questions.explanation: Loop runs 3 times: i=0 prints 'A', i=1 prints 'B', i=2 prints 'C' (default). Break only exits switch, not loop. Output: ABC

questions.title: Post-increment in Condition
questions.explanation: x++ returns old value for comparison, but x is already incremented when printed. Compares 0, 1, 2 but prints 1, 2, 3. Output: 1 2 3

questions.title: Goto Error Handling Pattern
questions.explanation: error is true, so goto jumps to cleanup label, skipping 'Success' print. Only prints 'Cleanup'. Output: Cleanup
hints: goto skips code to the label

questions.title: Loop Unrolling Benefit
questions.description: What is the primary benefit of loop unrolling?
options: Reduces loop overhead and branch prediction misses
questions.explanation: Loop unrolling reduces the number of iterations, decreasing loop overhead (increment, comparison, branch) and improving CPU pipeline efficiency.

questions.title: Multiple Comma Operators
questions.explanation: Comma operator evaluates b = 2 (b becomes 2), c = 3 (c becomes 3), then b + c (returns 5), which is assigned to a. Output: 5 2 3
hints: a gets the final expression value

questions.title: Empty Switch Statement
questions.explanation: An empty switch statement is valid. It does nothing and execution continues. Output: Done

questions.title: Short-Circuit Complex Expression
questions.explanation: a is 1 (true), so || short-circuits. The entire right side (b = 1) && (c = 1) is not evaluated. b and c remain 0. result is 1. Output: 1 1 0 0
